question.xref: DES s6, HC p102, KYTS p119
question.text: You see this amber traffic light ahead. Which light or lights, will come on next?

explanation.text: At junctions controlled by traffic lights you must stop behind the white line until the lights change to green. Red and amber lights showing together also mean stop. You may proceed when the light is green unless your exit road is blocked or pedestrians are crossing in front of you. If you’re approaching traffic lights that are visible from a distance and the light has been green for some time they are likely to change. Be ready to slow down and stop.
